p: In Fig 5(d) there appears to be some negative correlation between m and FI âˆž, with larger values of m corresponding to smaller epidemic sizes; see Table 2. However, we note that this is more an artefact of the data than a predictive trend, and it is possible to have epidemic pairs with a large value of m but very different final epidemic sizes and epidemic time-course dynamics. This can be seen for example in Fig 7 for epidemic pairs 3 and 4 from Table 4. Once again, the pair with higher average susceptibility has both a larger epidemic size, and also a faster time course for the spread of the disease.
